MEANHack '16 - You are selected!
You are one of the top teams that will compete on December 16th, 2016
December 16th, 2016
08:00 AM IST
Miracle Heights
Dear ,
Congratulations! Your team has been selected to participate in MEANHack @ Digital Summit 2016 on December 16th, 2016. You have been assigned to the "Enterprise Mobility" track. The application idea that you have to build will be provided to you at the event, below are a set of videos that will help you prepare yourself for the competition. More information about accommodation during the event can be found here. You will also receive a reminder email with reporting details next week.
Check out the other teams that are competing!
Training Material for "Enterprise Mobility" Track
The following videos will help you train for the MEANHack '16 event. Please make sure that you go through each of the videos and try the tutorials yourself as well. Also do some advanced reading on those topics and ensure that your entire team is prepared. The better preparation you have, the better chance your team will have of winning the tournament.
Access the code packets for the tutorials!
Tutorials That Would Help You!!
Consuming API's in Ionic and Angular JS
Want to consume your backend APIs in your Ionic-built apps? In this tutorial Hema Guvvala from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to consume an API using AngularJS in Ionic Framework.
View Tutorial
Creating your Hello World Ionic Hybrid App
Want to start developing Hybrid Apps using Ionic? In this tutorial Venkatesh Voona from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to create a Hello World Application with the side menu template in Ionic framework.
View Tutorial
Introduction to Node JS and Express JS
Want to build scalable apps in JavaScript? In this tutorial Geetha Adhikari from Miracle's AP Cloud Initiative Team will showcase how you can create and serve JSON and HTML content through Express and Node JS.
View Tutorial
Using Sockets and Ionic for a Mobile Chat App
Want to build a mobile chat application using Ionic? In this tutorial Vinod Kumar Marupu from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to create a chat app with the help of the Ionic Framework and Socket.io.
View Tutorial
Organization and Space Management in Bluemix
Want to start deploying your applications in Bluemix? In this tutorial Manasa Sutapalli from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to create an account in IBM Bluemix and deploy your applications.
View Tutorial
Using Sockets with Node JS for 2-Way Communication
Socket.io provides a great framework to build chat apps. In this tutorial Sasank Bhavaraju from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to implement a simple chat app using Socket.io.
View Tutorial
Pushing your first Node JS App to Bluemix
Want your Node applications to be in the Cloud? In this tutorial Pavani Gedala from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to quickly deploy a Node JS application on to IBM Bluemix with the help of the CloudFoundry CLI.
View Tutorial
Pushing your first Java App to Bluemix
Want your Java applications to be in the Cloud? In this tutorial Udaya Nandipati from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to quickly deploy a Java application on to IBM Bluemix with the help of the CloudFoundry CLI.
View Tutorial
Base64 to Image Encoding in JavaScript
Want to get Base64 URL of an image? In this tutorial Hema Guvvala form Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to convert an image to base64 format and vise versa in JavaScript.
View Tutorial
Consuming Cloudant APIs in your Node JS applications
Want to consume Cloudant APIs with Node JS? In this tutorial Pavani Gedala from Miracle's Innovation Labs will showcase how to consume a Cloudant API using NodeJS and Unirest.
View Tutorial
